data.title: Ecuador (2012)
data.meta_description: This documentary profiles Rafael Correa, an established economist who was elected Ecuador's president in 2006 and quickly transformed a country with archaic structures into a participatory democracy.
data.text:
Documentary about the descision of Ecuador to not pay back their debth to the worldbank and instead to reconstruct the country and support the local people.

The socialist ex-president Rafael Correa (2007-2017), other politicians, a priest, bank officials and normal people are explaining their positions. A goal is being introduced to establish a fair economy (sharp tongues might say it´s a propaganda movie). The introduced ideas are almost too good to be true.

Then, we are informed about the offer Ecuador made to the EU to not destroy the rain forest for the production of oil if the rich countries were willing to pay compensations for the conservation of the forest.

The quality of the pictures are good and the staging is ok.

I didn´t find out what came out of these ideas but it seems that the project of conserving the rain forest has been given up, probably because nobody wanted to engage.
